Color Themes

Pre built color themes

A color theme adds color styles instantaneously to your page. It adds color to header, body, footer, buttons, borders, tables and tables. It also sets fonts and colors for headings.

Additonal classes are available to just change an elements background color or text color as per the theme.

Easy to customize by modifying the corresponding SASS file and generating the CSS. A new theme can be generated similarly.
There are three styles available.
Apply the theme class to the body.
Use these classes.

  • Red color theme. Use class .redtheme
  • Bake colors theme. Use class .baketheme
  • Natural colors theme. Use class .naturaltheme

    • Additional classes

  • Red theme background. Use class .cl-red-bgred
  • Red theme text. Use class .cl-red-txtred
  • Bake theme background. Use class .cl-bake-bgcolor
  • Bake theme text. Use class .cl-bake-txtcolor
  • Natural theme background. Use class .cl-natural-bgcolor
  • Natural theme text. Use class .cl-natural-txtcolor

HTML with classes

Typography

Text

The framework provides responsive text size by default. It is applied to all paragraph text(<p>), list items <li>, link tags(<a>) and heading tags <h1> thru <h6> as per the following numbers.

Fonts

The framework provides some basic fonts most apt for the home based food businesses.
The classes come with a series of fonts or just a single font with a fallback.
Include the following link in your html file to have access to the fonts.

Following font classes are available.

  • Balsamiq. Use class .cl-font-balsamiq
  • Caveat. Use class .cl-font-caveat
  • Cookie. Use class .cl-font-cookie
  • Dancing Script. Use class .cl-font-dancing-script
  • Lato. Use class .cl-font-lato
  • Lobster. Use class .cl-font-lobster
  • Open Sans. Use class .cl-font-open-sans
  • Poppins. Use class .cl-font-poppins
  • Satisfy. Use class .cl-font-satisfy
  • Family of san-serif fonts. Use class .cl-san-serif
  • Family of monospace fonts. Use class .cl-mono
  • Family of handwriting fonts. Use class .cl-writing
  • Family of display fonts. Use class .cl-disp

HTML with classes

    <p class="cl-font-balsamiq">Balsamiq</p>
    <p class="cl-font-caveat">Caveat</p>
    <p class="cl-font-cookie">Cookie</p>
    <p class="cl-font-dancing-script">Dancing Script</p>
    <p class="cl-font-lato">Lato</p>
    <p class="cl-font-lobster">Lobster</p>
    <p class="cl-font-open-sans">Open Sans</p>
    <p class="cl-font-poppins">Poppins</p>
    <p class="cl-font-satisfy">Satisfy</p>

Headings

The framework provides pre-styled responsive headings for h1 thru h6.
The same styles are also provided as classes h1 through h6, to be used anywhere on the website.

Using element tag h1 through h6

HTML with classes

    <h1> Heading1 </h1> 

    <h2> Heading2 </h2> 

    <h3> Heading3 </h3> 

    <h4> Heading4 </h4> 

    <h5> Heading5 </h5> 

    <h6> Heading6 </h6>

Heading 6

Heading style on p element using classes h1 through h6

HTML with classes

    <p class="h1">Heading 1</p> 

    <p class="h2">Heading 2</p> 

    <p class="h3">Heading 3</p> 

    <p class="h4">Heading 4</p> 

    <p class="h5">Heading 5</p> 

    <p class="h6">Heading 6</p>

Inline Text Elements

The framework provides some basic styling for inline elements.

Following classes are available.

  • Bold. Use class .cl-bold
  • Italic. Use class .cl-italic
  • Cite. Use class .cl-cite
  • Code. Use class .cl-code
  • Var. Use class .cl-var
  • Abbr. Use class .cl-abbr
  • Address. Use class .cl-address
  • Blockquote. Use class .cl-blockquote

Horizontal alignment

The framework provides classes for alignment on x axis.

Following classes are available.

  • Left align. Use class .cl-align-left
  • Right align. Use class .cl-align-right
  • Center align. Use class .cl-align-center

HTML with classes

Aligned left using class cl-align-left

Aligned rigth using class cl-align-right

Aligned center using class cl-align-center

Vertical alignment

The framework provides classes for alignment on y axis.

Following classes are available.

  • Top align. Use class .cl-valign-top
  • Bottom align. Use class .cl-valign-bottom
  • Center align. Use class .cl-valign-center

HTML with classes

Aligned top using class cl-valign-top

Aligned bottom using class cl-valign-bottom

Aligned center using class cl-align-center

Alignments for flex items.

The framework provides classes for alignment of flex content on x-axis, y-axis and horizontal alignment on the same row.

Classes to justify flex content

  • Flex start. Use class .cl-flex-h-start
  • Flex end. Use class .cl-flex-h-end
  • Flex center. Use class .cl-flex-h-center
  • Space around. Use class .cl-flex-h-sp-around
  • Space between. Use class .cl-flex-h-sp-between

Classes to align flex content

  • Flex start. Use class .cl-flex-v-start
  • Flex end. Use class .cl-flex-v-end
  • Flex center. Use class .cl-flex-v-center
  • Space around. Use class .cl-flex-v-sp-around
  • Space between. Use class .cl-flex-v-sp-between

Classes to align flex items

  • Flex start. Use class .cl-flex-i-start
  • Flex end. Use class .cl-flex-i-end
  • Center. Use class .cl-flex-i-center
  • Stretch. Use class .cl-flex-i-stretch
  • Baseline. Use class .cl-flex-i-baseline

Classes for self aligning flex items

  • Vertical center. Use class .cl-self-vcenter
  • Horizontal center. Use class .cl-self-hcenter
  • Center. Use class .cl-self-center

Text transformation

The framework provides classes for text transformations.

Following classes are available.

  • Upper case. Use class .cl-txt-upper
  • Lower case. Use class .cl-txt-lower
  • Capital case. Use class .cl-txt-capital
  • Text shadow1. Use class .cl-txt-shadow1
  • Text shadow2. Use class .cl-txt-shadow2

Border styles

The framework provides classes for applying borders.

Following classes are available.

  • Solid border. Use class .cl-bs-solid
  • Groove border. Use class .cl-bs-groove
  • Dotted border. Use class .cl-bs-dotted
  • Outset border. Use class .cl-bs-outset
  • Dashed border. Use class .cl-bs-dashed

Buttons

Default buttons


Default buttons come with a basic styling.
They have a background color, border and hover styles applied to them.
Disabled buttons do not have a pointer.

HTML

    <button>Default</button>class="cl-blk"

    <button class="cl-blk cl-btn-disabled">Disabled</button>

    <input type="button" value="input type button"class="cl-blk">

    <input type="submit" value="input type Submit"class="cl-blk">

    <input type="reset" value="input type reset"class="cl-blk">




Button Sizes

Buttons have 5 sizes available.

  • Extra small button. Use class .cl-btn-xsm
  • Small button. Use class .cl-btn-sm
  • Regular button. No class required. It's default size.
  • Large button. Use class .cl-btn-lg
  • Extra large button.Use class .cl-btn-xlg

HTML with classes

    <button class="cl-btn-xsm">xsm button</button> 

    <button class="cl-btn-sm">sm button</button>

    <button>reg button</button>

    <button class="cl-btn-lg">large button</button>

    <button class="cl-btn-xlg">xl button</button>

Button Styles

Buttons have 5 styles available.

  • Sharp button. Use class .cl-btn-sharp
  • Soft button. Use class .cl-btn-soft
  • Oval button. Use class .cl-btn-oval
  • Round button. Use class .cl-btn-round
  • 3D button.Use class .cl-btn-shadow

HTML with classes

    <button class="cl-btn-sharp cl-blk">sharp</button>

    <button class="cl-btn-soft cl-blk">soft</button>

    <button class="cl-btn-oval cl-blk">oval</button>

    <button class="cl-btn-round cl-blk">round</button>

    <button class="cl-btn-shadow cl-blk">3d</button>




Utility Classes

The framework provides some basic utility classes for building the pages.

Print control

Prevent certain content on a page from printing. Use class.cl-no-print

Floating Content

Occasionally there is a need to float content and clear those floats. Use these classes.

  • Float left. Use class .cl-float-left
  • Float right. Use class .cl-float-right
  • Clear float. Use class .cl-clear-float

Google Maps

Occasionally there is a need to embed location on a map using Google maps. Use this class on your container element to make it responsive..cl-map-wrapper.
Pay attention to remove frameborder="0" style="border:0;"from the embed code you get from google maps for the iframe.



Small map for SDCE North Campus Location

Images

Images are a integral part of any website. Following classes are availlable for styling images. You may use padding and margin classes for space management

  • Responsive Image. Use class .cl-img-fluid
  • Soft edges. Use class .cl-img-soft
  • Round images. Use class .cl-img-circle
  • Outline images. Use class .cl-img-outline
  • Thumbnail images. Use class .cl-img-thumbnail. It sets image width and height to 60px each. Should not be used together with .cl-img-fluid

Basic Content display

To quickly change the block display properties of an element use these classes.
These are handy when using lists for making menus or navigation

  • Inline. Use class .cl-inline
  • Inline block. Use class .cl-inline-blk
  • Block. Use class .cl-blk

    • Use these classes to manipulate the list item in an ordered or unordered list

  • Display all list items as inline block. Use class .cl-inline-blk-list on a ul or ol
  • Display list markers inside. Use class .cl-lsp-in
  • Display list markers outside. Use class .cl-lsp-out

Spacing content

Basic classes are availble for space management with paddding and margin around elements.
All spacing is applied inclass ems.


Margin Classes

  • Margin of .5em on all sides. Use class .m5
  • Margin of 1em on all sides. Use class .m10
  • Margin of .5em on left and right. Use class .mx5
  • Margin of 1em on left and right. Use class .mx10
  • Margin of .5em on top and bottom. Use class .my5
  • Margin of 1em on top and bottom. Use class .my10

Padding Classes

  • Padding of .5em on all sides. Use class .p5
  • Padding of 1em on all sides. Use class .p10
  • Padding of .5em on left and right. Use class .px5
  • Padding of 1em on left and right. Use class .px10
  • Padding of .5em on top and bottom. Use class .py5
  • Padding of 1em on top and bottom. Use class .py10

Tables

We provide a variety of options to style your tables.

  • Default basic styling for every table includes table border and header border. Use class .cl-table-basic
  • Fully styled table is available with borders, zebra stripes and hover. Use class .cl-table
  • Zebra striping can be achieved by applying classes on alternate, even or odd rows. You may stripe even, odd, or both rows. Class can be overrriden to change the color of the stripe. Use classes .cl-even and .cl-odd
  • Hover option classes for striped rows are applied similar to zebra striping. Colors can be changed. Classes are .cl-even-hover and .cl-odd-hover
  • Highlighter classes are available to highlight a particular row .cl-hightlight-green , .cl-highlight-yellow and .cl-highlight-alert
    <table class="cl-table-basic">
        <caption> Basic table</caption>
        <thead>
        <tr>
            <th>Name</th>
            <th>Category</th>
            <th>Plan</th>
        </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
        <tr class="cl-highlight-green">
            <td>Anthony Zeid</td>
            <td>3</td>
            <td>Weekly</td>
        </tr>
        <tr class="cl-even cl-even-hover">
            <td>Roman</td>
            <td>2</td>
            <td>Daily</td>
        </tr>
        <tr class="cl-highlight-yellow">
            <td>Rina Joy</td>
            <td>1</td>
            <td>monthly</td>
        </tr>      
        <tr class="cl-highlight-alert">
            <td>Tina Turner</td>
            <td>1</td>
            <td>Annual</td>
        </tr>                              
    </table>

Anthony Zeid 3 Weekly
Roman 2 Daily
Rina Joy 1 monthly
Tina Turner 1 Annual

Responsive Tables

We provide three breakpoints for responsive tables.

  • A small table of 3X3 is responsive till the small breakpoint at 640px. Use class .cl-res-table-sm
  • A medium size table of 5x3 is responsive till the medium breakpoint at 768px. Use class .cl-res-table-md
  • A larger table, larger than medium, is responsive till the last breakpoint at 960px. Use class .cl-res-table-lg
  • Pre-styled table. To use the styling applied to the folowing tables use class .cl-table

In order to have the column heading display on the responsive table they need to be set on the td.
For example for the small table you will have to specify the following in the media query.
There are three column headings so we go upto nth-of-type(3). 

        @media screen and(max-width: 640px){
        .cl-res-table-sm td:nth-of-type(1):before {
            content: "Heading Col1";
            }
            .cl-res-table-sm td:nth-of-type(2):before {
            content: "Heading Col2";
            }
            .cl-res-table-sm td:nth-of-type(3):before {
            content: "Heading Col3";
            }           
        }
        }
Responsive Small Table
Heading Col 1 Heading Col 2 Heading Col 3
Data Col 1a Data Col 2a Data Col 3a
Data Col 1b Data Col 2b Data Col 3b
Data Col 1c Data Col 2c Data Col 3c

Forms

The framework provides default styling for form elemnts. You may override as per your need.

Following defaults have been changed.

  • Inputs have borders, box shadows, responsive height. Default width is set to 50%.
  • Check boxes and radio buttons have stylling applied to.

HTML

<form action="#" class="cl-align-left">
    <fieldset class=" px5">
        <legend> Basic form elements</legend>

        <label for="fname">First Name:</label>
        <input type="text" name="fname" id='fname'><br />
        <label for="lname">Last Name:</label>
        <input type="text" name="lname" id='lname'><br />
        
        <label for="browser">Browser:</label>
        <input list="browsers" name="browser" id-="browser">
        <datalist id="browsers">
            <option value="Internet Explorer">
            <option value="Firefox">
            <option value="Chrome">
            <option value="Opera">
            <option value="Safari">
        </datalist><br />
        
        <label for="date">Date:</label>
        <input type="date" id="date" name="date"> <br />

        <label for="month">Month:</label>
        <select id="month">            
            <option value="1">January</option>
            <option value="2">February</option>
            <option value="3">March</option>
            <option value="4">April</option>
            <option value="5">May</option>
            <option value="6">June</option>
            <option value="7">July</option>
            <option value="8">August</option>
            <option value="9">September</option>
            <option value="10">October</option>
            <option value="11">November</option>
            <option value="12">December</option>
        </select><br />
    
        <label for="comments">Comments</label>
        <textarea name="comments" id="comments" cols="10" rows="6" placeholder="Enter in 100 words"></textarea><br />
    </fieldset>
    <fieldset  class=" px5">
        <legend>Default check boxes</legend>
        <div>
            <input type="checkbox" id="vehicle1" name="vehicle1" value="Bike">
            <label for="vehicle1"> I have a bike</label><br>
            <input type="checkbox" id="vehicle2" name="vehicle2" value="Car">
            <label for="vehicle2"> I have a car</label><br>
            <input type="checkbox" id="vehicle3" name="vehicle3" value="Boat">
            <label for="vehicle3"> I have a boat</label>            
        </div>

    </fieldset>
    <fieldset class=" px5">
        <legend>Radio Boxes</legend>
        <div>
            <h4>Default Radio buttons</h4>
            <input type="radio" id="male" name="gender" value="male">
            <label for="male">Male</label><br>
            <input type="radio" id="female" name="gender" value="female">
            <label for="female">Female</label><br>
            <input type="radio" id="other" name="gender" value="other">
            <label for="other">Other</label>            
        </div>
    </fieldset>

</form>

Tab panels

Tabs are ideal for one/two page web applications where space is less or for displaying content on different topics of same subjects.


Swiftly provides horizontal tabbed panels and vertical tabbed panels.

Horizontal tabs

Three tabs panel.

  • Structure your html using the ids and classes as mentioned in the example code.
  • Make a link to swiftly-tabs.js in your html.
  • The names of classes and ids should match those used in javascript. They are .tabcontent, .tablinks, #defaultopen.
  • The classes used for styling are: .panelh, .hpanelh, .hpanelb and .htabs

HTML with classes
  • Tab1
  • Tab2
  • Tab3

Tab 1 heading

Content for first tab goes here.

Lorem ipsum dolor, sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Dolore, recusandae non. Magnam ipsa sed illo quaerat provident et ullam doloremque rem minima consequatur, vitae natus ea. Accusantium ex distinctio magnam.

Tab 2 heading

Content for second tab goes here.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit, amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Dolorem commodi beatae a vel, possimus consequuntur sed amet quisquam qui eveniet laborum voluptatibus sequi aliquam, expedita blanditiis officia ipsa, iusto corrupti?

Tab 3 heading

Content for third tab goes here.

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Totam facere adipisci libero nesciunt molestias impedit voluptatum, fugiat esse, quasi voluptatem, architecto hic? Accusamus excepturi voluptatibus, molestias a reprehenderit aliquam numquam?

Vertical tabs

Three tabs panel.

  • Structure your html using the ids and classes as mentioned in the example code.
  • Make a link to swiftly-tabs.js in your html.
  • The names of classes and ids should match those used in javascript. They are .tabcontent, .tablinks, #defaultopen.
  • The classes used for styling are: .panelh, .vpanelh, .vpanelb and .vtabs

HTML with classes
  • Tab1
  • Tab2
  • Tab3

Content for third tab goes here.

Slideshow with controls


The ability to automate the display of images, in a round robin continuously, can be achieved using this component. It also provides the ability to play/pause the slideshow.
You could also manually move to the next or previous images.

  • Structure your html using the ids and classes as mentioned in the example code.
  • Make a link to swiftly-slideshow.js in your html.
  • The names of classes and ids should match those used in javascript. They are classes: .cl-ss-slide, .showing, and ids: #slides, #pause, #prev and #next.
  • The classes used for styling are: .cl-ss(for container), .cl-ss-ul, .cl-ss-controller and .cl-ss-controls

HTML with classes

Javascript

Jumbotron

Jumbotrons are ideal for presenting focus text to your consumer.


Swiftly provides the option to do so, with just text or with image background

Simple Jumbotron

  • Structure your html using the classes as mentioned in the example code.
  • Make a link to swiftly.min.css or swiftly.css in your html.
  • The class used for styling is: .jumbotron. This add default padding and margin.
  • To use full width of the page add class: .jumbotron-fluid to your container element.

HTML with classes

Title

Some content here

This is a simple hero unit, component, for calling extra attention to featured content or information.


It uses utility classes for typography and spacing to space content out within the larger container.

Learn more

Jumbotron with Image

  • Structure your html using the classes as mentioned in the example code.
  • Make a link to swiftly.min.css or swiftly.css in your html.
  • The class used for styling is .jumbotron. This add default padding and margin.
  • To use full width of the page add class .jumbotron-fluid to your container element.
  • To provide image for the background add class .jumbotron-img to your container element. Override it in your css to specify the image source. Default gradient is provided as fallback in the event of image not available.
    #j-img.jumbotron-img{ background-image: -webkit-gradient(linear, left top, left bottom, from(rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)), to(rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5))), url("../images/bg-jumbotron500.jpg"); background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0), rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)), url("../images/bg-jumbotron500.jpg"); }

HTML with classes

Title

Some content here

This is a simple hero unit, component, for calling extra attention to featured content or information.


It uses utility classes for typography and spacing to space content out within the larger container.

Learn more

Navigation

The framework provides different types of navigation or menu styles.


These are responsive to small screens. They are simple horizontal navigation bar, simple vertical navigation bar and dropdown nav with stick left nav.

Responsive Horizontal Navigation

HTML with classes
Responsive Horizontal Navigation With Drop Down
  • Lev01 - Pg1
  • Dropdown ↓
    Lev02 - Pg1 Lev02 - Pg2
  • Lev01 - Pg2
  • Lev01 - Pg3

Responsive Vertical Navigation

The responsive vertical navigation with dropdown is built the same as the horizontal one. The only difference is the classes and id's used. They are: .nav-01V, and #nav-V in place of .nav-01H, and #nav-H


If you choose to not include the dropdown content, simply include a regular link.

HTML with classes
Responsive Vertical Navigation With Drop Down
  • Lev01 - Pg1
  • Dropdown ↓
    Lev02 - Pg1 Lev02 - Pg2
  • Lev01 - Pg2
  • Lev01 - Pg3

Responsive Vertical Navigation

This example shows a simple navigation with options aligned vertically.


Pay special attention to using the same class and id names.

Simple Responsive Vertical Navigation
  • Lev01 - Pg1
  • Lev01 - Pg2
  • Lev01 - Pg3

GRID System

The framework provides a responsive Grid.


It is based on the 12 column grid system which is a popular industry standars..

Responsive Grid with Equal Sizing

All Rows with Class=".col-XX" Should Add to no more than 12


HTML with classes

All Rows with Class=".col-XX" Should Add to no more than 12
